BioModel.name: CM_PM12648679_MB2::Protein_phosphorylation_hyperbolic
BioModel.text: S = signal strength. For example, S could be the concentration of mRNA.
S = signal strength. For example, S could be the concentration of mRNA.
This ModelBrick from the article, " Sniffers, buzzers, toggles and blinkers... " describes protein phosphorylation and dephosphorylation, yielding a hyperbolic signal-response curve.
R = response magnitude. For example, R could be the concentration of protein. The phosphorylated form of R is supposed to be the active form.
RP = phosphorylated form of the response element. The phosphorylated form of R is supposed to be the active form.
R = response magnitude. For example, R could be the concentration of protein.
